Summary: Four Seasons Pacifica has never been disappointing. Very nice place to stay with clean rooms and great views. Sunsets are the best. This is the 3rd visit and it was absolutely awesome. Just a couple minute walk to the ocean and maybe a 5 minute walk to the dock. Couple good places to eat there as well. Walking distance to the shops downtown San Clemente is maybe a 10-15 walk.

Summary Heading: Perfect vacation at the 4 Seasons Pacifica and at the San Clemente Inn!!!
Summary: I would recommend both of these places to stay in a heart beat. I've spent a week at both this year and had a fantastic time every time. The staff are all super friendly and most helpful, the rooms are clean, super spacious and provide everything you would need and both locations are close to the beach with amazing views from the room. My family and I can't wait for our next trip.

Summary Heading: Beautiful View, so comfortable, awesome amenities!
Summary: Had a wonderful stay at the Four Seasons Pacifica. Park your car in the garage and enjoy the short walk to restaurants, shops, or to the beach. This roomy two bedroom has everything you could ask for. The full kitchen  is just like home--convenient and comfortable and the living room is comfortable and spacious. There is a patio where you can dine or just enjoy the sun and views--a beautiful park is right across the street. Go enjoy your stay at the Four Seasons!

Just gorgeous view of the ocean.  Clean comfortable convenient.   All around great location.  Would definitely go back again. Great eateries nearby - within walkng distance.  Professional management and Loved that the beach was just down the hill.

My friends and I recently stayed at Four Seasons Pacifica in a two bedroom, two bath unit. The unit was extremely spacious and well appointed. It had a full kitchen with everything we needed to enjoy our stay. The location is outstanding, just a short walk to the beach and pier as well as into town with shops and restaurants within walking distance. Four Seasons Pacifica even had a garage space so we didn't have to worry about parking for the duration of our stay. I highly recommend Four Seasons Pacifica!
Room tip: Great location with all the comforts of home

Summary: My family of five stayed at Four Seasons Pacifica, Las Brisas Unit #5, and we enjoyed every minute! From the easy checkin process to the luxurious and huge accommodations, we were impressed by every detail. The rooms were large, the beds very comfortable, and the full kitchen complete with dishes, pots, pans, utensils, toaster, coffee pot, and even a dishwasher. The staff was extraordinary and ensured our needs were met. Our room was spacious and clean, and we felt comfortable and safe, even amid the COVID pandemic. The unobstructed ocean view from the balcony is spectacular with the beach just a short walk from our unit. The location is not only close to the beach and the pier, but also convenient to top-rated restaurants, bars, and shops. My family and I are already planning

Had another awesome stay at Fours Seasons Pacifica. Very quite neighborhood and the place is just perfect. Rooms were very clean and up to date. Definitely will come back for even a longer stay. Management is top of the line. Had no issues, but could tell that management would go above and beyond to help in any situation. Less than a two minute walk to the ocean. Great food within a 10-15 walk. Ice cream as well. Lol. Great sunsets as well. Great place to stay.

This unit is amazing!!   From the decor to the location, absolute perfection!!!!  There was not one thing that was missed when it came to them providing everything!!!!  The kitchen was immaculate and the living room spacious!!!!  The set up was perfect!!  The 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms were more than enough room with all 3 of us!  We never felt crowded at all.  It is close to so many cute shops, restaurants, beaches, and wine tastings!!!!  It is quiet , yet the area is active.  Runners, dogs and surfers were visible when you looked out over balcony and when went outside.  Would definitely stay again when I come back!!

Checking in was a little tricky as the front desk was 2 miles away at San Clemente Inn and the directions given at the front desk to Four Seasons Pacifica were long. It is in a quiet residential area with only 5 units, all of which were empty except the 3 bedroom on the top floor (3rd) where we strayed. The unit was very specious with 3 large bedroom and 3 baths. The decor was retro 50s, but completely upgraded with open beam ceilings, huge travertine fireplace with gas lighter, a wonderful balcony with seating for 4 and a gas BBQ which overlooked Linda Lane Park and the beautiful Pacific Ocean. The kitchen had every dish, cutlery and pans you could imagine in lovely colored stoneware. It had stainless steel appliances and granite countertops. The tables and bathrooms also had
Room tip: Request La Bahia 3 bedroom on top floor for a spectacular ocean view.

Summary: Checked in on a Friday evening. As always, curious about what the room would be like. It was probably one of the best rooms, if not the best rooms we have stayed in. It was beyond clean and very well maintained. Had its own garage for vehicle to be parked in overnight. Beautiful walk to the ocean front to watch a couple awesome sunsets. So many choices of food within a 5-10 minute walk. My only regret was to not stay longer. Could easily spend an extended amount of time there with no problem. No issues checking in. The manager there was very helpful in making decisions on what to do during the stay, as there are so many options. Again, had an awesome stay with the only complaint of not staying longer. One photo of an awesome sunset.

We did a Interval International trade with this property, and while we did all our research regarding the units, we were disappointed there was no air conditioning!  I called ahead of time inquiring as to why there was no air conditioning in the units, and I was told with the ocean breeze we wouldn't need it. Well, that was far from true. It was miserably hot in the unit the entire week. Even at night. So if you are interested in coming back to a nice cool unit after a fun day out in the city, don't stay here.   The place was very clean and quiet and it was nice to have a garage to park the car

I am an owner of a 2 bedroom 2 bath timeshare unit at Four Seasons Pacifica. I am always happy to come here each year. The views are wonderful, the BBQ on the balcony produces some wonderful dinners and walks and swims at the nearby beach are refreshing.  It is a short walk to the San Clemente pier and the downtown restaurant district. This location is so much better than any sort of "resort" property. You really experience the Surf City vibe. I'm sure you will like it also.

2 bed/2 bath unit, beautiful place, recently renovated, clean, comfortable & a great view! Great beach access, with a lot of nearby restaurants & shops. Pool & resort facilities are about 1.5 miles away, slight inconvenience but very nice facilities!   Biggest complaints: Automatic lights in the bathrooms, unfortunately I am one of those people that can't make it all night without a bathroom break which is bad enough, but getting blasted with bright light makes it worse!! When you shut it off your movements turn light back on. We shut the "guest bath" door at night because the sensor would pickup movement in the mirror.  Unit could use a few more items such as a cooler & scissors.  No ice machine on site, but available at the main resort. All of this is minor stuff!  We really

Spotless.  Beautiful views from balcony, especially the 3 bedroom unit.  Very well equipped for all needs.  Walking distance  to the beautiful beach, short downnhill walk.  Walking back takes a bit of endurance, but after a few times, it gets easier.  Lovely.

We stayed in a 2 bedroom/2 bath and it was wonderful, clean and nicely decorated. The beds were comfortable and the kitchen nicely stocked. There was more than enough room for the four of us. The view of the sunset every night from the balcony is beautiful.  I loved the sound of the distant trains at night and the fact that you can walk to the ocean. There are beaches for surfing and a park right across the street for smaller children. So many restaurants are close by and one of my favorites, Fisherman's, is right on the pier, within walking distance of Four Seasons/Pacifica. It was a perfect Southern California vacation.

Summary Heading: I have been a timeshare traveler since 1984.  This, in my opinion, was a top tier timeshare!  Loved it!
Summary: We had the good fortune to exchange into this timeshare for the first week of April.  Even better, we got the 3BR Las Brisas unit on the top floor.  What a magnificent condo with the most incredible views.  Everything seemed to be in like-new condition.  It has a very modern decor.  This condominium of five units is located in a quiet residential area.  It's probably extremely busy in the summer time though with the beach, a nice park, the pier and coastal trail all accessible from the street that runs along the side of the building.  However, while we were there, it was quite enjoyable and relaxing.  It's a nice little area of activity for happy, friendly folks out enjoying a safe and inviting environment.  The unit is huge with three nice size bedrooms (king, queen, two bunks,

We stayed at Four Seasons Pacifica for a weekend and we were in the unit "Oceano".  In this little condo, each unit has a different layout with an assigned garage.  "Oceano" is a 2-bedroom unit with two bathrooms, and a pull-out couch in living room.  The master bathroom has a jacuzzi tub.  The master bedroom's bed is very hard though.  People with back problem may have hard time with it.  The unit is very spacious, with a big size living room and median size kitchen and dinning room.  There are also plenty of storage areas in each room and the hall way.  There are three TVs, fire place, and a BBQ grill on balcony.  The balcony has a great ocean view to the left, though it is a bit smaller than ideal.  The area is very quiet and we could her the ocean waves in our unit.  There

Summary Heading: Four Seasons Pacifica, San Clemente California
Summary: These days, where "retreat" is a magical word few actually come to realize during a vacation stay, Four Seasons Pacifica in San Clemente California nails it, hands down.    There are a total of six units, each with a different name and slightly different floor plan.  We stayed in the "Miramar" unit, which is the first floor corner unit, most accessible from the street.  Initially, we thought the higher view units had an advantage.  However, we quickly redirected our prospective and respect for the first floor unit as we watched the calm nature of the community enjoying the adjacent park and stroll ways.  You can definitely see the ocean and feel the breeze from all the unit's windows.  But there are so many other charming aspects to staying here, that it doesn't make it

At top of hill overlooking ocean.  Easy walk to boardwalk and beach.  Nice hiking trail along ocean.  Spacious unit; two bedroom.  Nicely furnished; somewhat dated.  Convenient walk to main street in quaint downtown.  Has an enclosed garage.  A bit of a climb on street to ocean.
If you want a true getaway this is your place . 5 units all 2 and 3 bedrooms with gas bbq's and garages. All units have full ocean view. Unbelievable in a good way!!!
